member.name: M:FaunaDB.Client.FaunaClient.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Net.Http.HttpClient,System.Version,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance of with the specified arguments.
member.param: Auth token for the FaunaDB server.
URL for the FaunaDB server. Defaults to "https://db.fauna.com:443"
Timeout for I/O operations. Defaults to 1 minute.
Version of http. Default value is HttpVersion.Version11, is you use .net core 3.0 and above you can enable http/2 support by passing HttpVersion.Version20
Check new NuGet package driver version. Default value is true (Check new version).

member.name: M:FaunaDB.Client.FaunaClient.NewSessionClient(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new with the user secret provided. Queries submitted to a session client will be authenticated with the secret provided. A session client shares its parent's internal resources.
member.param: Auth token for the FaunaDB server.

member.name: M:FaunaDB.Client.FaunaClient.Query(FaunaDB.Query.Expr,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary:
Issues a Query to FaunaDB.
Queries are modeled through the FaunaDB query language, represented by the helper functions in the class.
Responses are modeled as a general response tree. Each node is a , and can be coerced to structured types through various methods on that class.
member.param: Timeout for that specific query (it will override the client timetout, if any).

member.name: M:FaunaDB.Client.FaunaClient.Query(FaunaDB.Query.Expr[])
member.summary:
Issues multiple queries to FaunaDB.
These queries are sent to FaunaDB in a single request, and are evaluated. The list of response nodes is returned in the same order as the issued queries.
See for more information on the individual queries.
member.param: the list of query expressions to be sent to FaunaDB.
member.returns: a containing an ordered list of root response nodes.

member.name: M:FaunaDB.Client.FaunaClient.Query(System.TimeSpan,FaunaDB.Query.Expr[])
member.summary:

These queries are sent to FaunaDB in a single request, and are evaluated. The list of response nodes is returned in the same order as the issued queries.
See for more information on the individual queries.

the list of query expressions to be sent to FaunaDB.
member.returns: a containing an ordered list of root response nodes.

member.name: T:FaunaDB.Errors.FaunaException
member.summary: Error returned by the FaunaDB server. For documentation of error types, see the docs.

member.name: P:FaunaDB.Errors.FaunaException.Errors
member.summary: List of all errors sent by the server.

member.name: T:FaunaDB.Errors.BadRequest
member.summary:
HTTP 400 error. An exception thrown if FaunaDB cannot evaluate a query.
HTTP 400 error.

member.name: T:FaunaDB.Errors.Unauthorized
member.summary:
HTTP 401 error. An exception thrown if FaunaDB responds with an HTTP 401 (Unauthorized).
HTTP 401 error.

member.name: T:FaunaDB.Errors.PermissionDenied
member.summary:
HTTP 403 error. An exception thrown if FaunaDB responds with an HTTP 403 (Permission Denied).
HTTP 403 error.

member.name: T:FaunaDB.Errors.NotFound
member.summary:
HTTP 404 error. An exception thrown if a HTTP 404 (Not Found) is returned from FaunaDB.
HTTP 404 error.

member.name: T:FaunaDB.Errors.InternalError
member.summary:
HTTP 500 error. An exception thrown if a HTTP 500 (Internal Server Error) occurs when making a request to FaunaDB. Such errors represent an internal failure within the database.
HTTP 500 error.

member.name: T:FaunaDB.Errors.UnavailableError
member.summary:
HTTP 503 error. An exception thrown if a FaunaDB host is unavailable for any reason. For example, if the client cannot connect to the host, or if the host does not respond.
HTTP 503 error.

member.name: T:FaunaDB.Errors.StreamingException
member.summary: An exception thrown if an error response returned during consumption of a stream

member.name: T:FaunaDB.Errors.UnknowException
member.summary: An exception thrown if a FaunaDB response is unknown or unparseable by the client.

member.summary:
Creates a new Filter expression.
FaunaDB Collection Functions
This is the raw version. Usually it's easier to use the overload.
See , , , , ,
member.param: Lambda expression created by . It must return a boolean value.

example.code:
var result = await client.Query(Filter(Arr(1, 2, 3, 4), Lambda("i", GT(Var("i"), 2))));
Assert.AreEqual(Arr(3, 4), result);

member.summary:
Creates a new Take expression.
FaunaDB Collection Functions
member.param: Number of elements to take from the head of collection

example.code:
var result = await client.Query(Take(2, Arr(1, 2, 3)));
Assert.AreEqual(Arr(1, 2), result);

member.name: T:FaunaDB.Types.FaunaString
member.summary: Instruct the encoder that this object should be treated as a string when stored in Fauna. The Encoder will call the object or primative type's .ToString() method. The Decoder will attempt to create an object with the constructor with a single string parameter. If it does not have that constructor the Decoder will fail. For primatives the Decoder will attempt to use standard system conversions to convert the string back to the primative type.

member.name: T:FaunaDB.Types.FaunaIgnoreAttribute
member.summary: Instruct the encoder to not encode the specified member.

member.name: T:FaunaDB.Types.FaunaConstructorAttribute
member.summary: Instruct the decoder wich constructor to use when decoding a object. It can also be used in a public static method instead in a constructor. That attribute can only be used once per class.

member.name: T:FaunaDB.Types.FaunaEnum
member.summary: Instruct the encoder/decoder to rename the annotated enum field. If not used the method will be used instead.
member.example: enum CpuTypes { [FaunaEnum("x86_32")] X86, [FaunaEnum("x86_64")] X86_64, ARM, MIPS }

member.name: P:FaunaDB.Types.FaunaEnum.Alias
member.summary: Alias used to encode/decode the enum value

member.name: M:FaunaDB.Types.BytesV.FromUrlSafeBase64(System.String)
member.summary:
Convert url-safe base64 encoded string to an array of bytes.
Given does not support url-safe strings, that method substitute the character '_' to '/' and '-' to '+' before doing the conversion.
More info in Wikipedia

member.name: M:FaunaDB.Types.BytesV.ToUrlSafeBase64(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Convert an array of bytes to an url-safe base64 encoded string.
Given does not produce url-safe strings, that method substitute the character '+' to '-' and '/' to '_' after the conversion.
More info in Wikipedia

member.name: T:FaunaDB.Types.Decoder
member.summary: FaunaDB to object decoder.

member.name: M:FaunaDB.Types.Decoder.Decode``1(FaunaDB.Types.Value)
member.summary: Decode the FaunaDB value into the specified type T.
member.example: Decode<int>(LongV.Of(10)) => 10 Decode<double>(DoubleV.Of(3.14)) => 3.14 Decode<bool>(BooleanV.True) => true Decode<object>(NullV.Instance) => null Decode<string>(StringV.Of("a string")) => "a string" Decode<int[]>(ArrayV.Of(1, 2)) => new int[] { 1, 2 } Decode<List<int>>(ArrayV.Of(1, 2)) => new List<int>> { 1, 2 } Decode<byte[]>(new ByteV(1, 2)) => new byte[] { 1, 2 } Decode<DateTime>(new TimeV("2000-01-01T01:10:30.123Z")) => new DateTime(2000, 1, 1, 1, 10, 30, 123) Decode<DateTime>(new DateV("2001-01-01")) => new DateTime(2001, 1, 1) Decode<User>(ObjectV.With("user_name", "john", "password", "s3cr3t")) => new User("john", "s3cr3t")
member.returns: An instance of type T
member.param: The FaunaDB value to be decoded
member.typeparam: The type name in which the value should be decoded

member.name: M:FaunaDB.Types.Decoder.Decode(FaunaDB.Types.Value,System.Type)
member.summary: Decode the FaunaDB value into the type specified in the argument.
member.example: Decode(LongV.Of(10), typeof(int)) => 10 Decode(DoubleV.Of(3.14), typeof(double)) => 3.14 Decode(BooleanV.True, typeof(bool)) => true Decode(NullV.Instance, typeof(object)) => null Decode(StringV.Of("a string"), typeof(string)) => "a string" Decode(ArrayV.Of(1, 2), typeof(int[])) => new int[] { 1, 2 } Decode(ArrayV.Of(1, 2), typeof(List<int>>)) => new List<int>> { 1, 2 } Decode(new ByteV(1, 2), typeof(byte[])) => new byte[] { 1, 2 } Decode(new TimeV("2000-01-01T01:10:30.123Z"), typeof(DateTime)) => new DateTime(2000, 1, 1, 1, 10, 30, 123) Decode(new DateV("2001-01-01"), typeof(DateTime)) => new DateTime(2001, 1, 1) Decode(ObjectV.With("user_name", "john", "password", "s3cr3t"), typeof(User)) => new User("john", "s3cr3t")
member.returns: An instance of type specified in the argument
member.param: The FaunaDB value to be decoded
The type in which the value should be decoded

member.name: T:FaunaDB.Types.Encoder
member.summary: FaunaDB object to encoder.

member.name: M:FaunaDB.Types.Encoder.Encode(System.Object)
member.summary: Encode the specified object into a corresponding FaunaDB value.
member.example: Encode(10) => LongV.Of(10) Encode(3.14) => DoubleV.Of(3.14) Encode(true) => BooleanV.True Encode(null) => NullV.Instance Encode("a string") => StringV.Of("a string") Encode(new int[] {1, 2}) => ArrayV.Of(1, 2) Encode(new List<int> {1, 2}) => ArrayV.Of(1, 2) Encode(new byte[] {1, 2}) => new ByteV(1, 2) Encode(DateTime.Now) => new TimeV("2000-01-01T01:10:30.123Z") Encode(DateTime.Today) => new DateV("2001-01-01") Encode(user) => ObjectV.With("user_name", "john", "password", "s3cr3t")
member.returns: A FaunaDB corresponding to the given argument
member.param: Any instance of user defined classes, primitive values or any generic collection like or

member.name: M:FaunaDB.Types.DateTimeUtil.TruncateLastTwoDigits(System.String)
member.summary: Given the response of the server use timestamps with high resolution it can represent timestamps with resolution of 1ns, like for example: 1970-01-01T00:00:00.000000001Z. However C# has a resolution of 100ns, so it cannot handle the last two digits of response.

member.name: T:FaunaDB.Types.Value
member.summary:
Represents any scalar or non-scalar value in the FaunaDB query language. FaunaDB value types consist of all of the JSON value types, as well as the FaunaDB-specific types, {@link RefV} and {@link SetRefV}.
Scalar values are , , , , , , and .
Non-scalar values are and .
This interface itself does not have any directly accessible data. It must first be coerced into a type before its data can be accessed.
See FaunaDB Value Types
